result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Byas, Clifton T

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clifton T Byas not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Clifton T Byas.  Attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. Outstanding out of county cases. State working on global offer.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Clifton T Byas
Current: 115 W Doty St, c/o DCJ, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 07-26-2022)
Prior: 3870 Port Washington, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.

03:16 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA moved the court to find cts transactionally related. Atty Idlas objects. Court made such finding. Det. J.P. sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA. Witness identified defn. Cross exam by Atty Idlas. Witness excused. State moved for bindover. Defn obj. Court found probable cause and ordered bindover.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Valentinus T. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

03:10 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
